title: Additonal stored XSS in Add note/Expected payment Date
vulnerability_information: When you make an invoice, the person you make the invoice out to can be an xss vector like "><video/poster/onerror=alert(0)>  then fill out the rest of the invoice and create it. Go to the invoice then when you go the invoice and click add note/expected date it'll trigger
vulnerability_information_html: When you make an invoice, the person you make the invoice out to can be an xss vector like "><video/poster/onerror=alert(0)> then fill out the rest of the invoice and create it. Go to the invoice then when you go the invoice and click add note/expected date it'll trigger

activities.message:
Hi Alyssa,

Thank you for submitting this report, we appreciate your effort in helping keep our users secure.

It's not clear which screen / url you are accessing, or which field you are entering the XSS injection into.

However, it does seem like this report is a duplicate of a report that was raised yesterday (#121583), which was the Sales Invoice screen in the "To" field.

As it's the same injection point, and the XSS is triggering on the same screen, I am going to merge your report with the earlier report so that you can track our progress as we resolve this issue.

Many thanks,

Kirk

activities.message:
Hi Alyssa,

Sorry, we marked this as a duplicate the other day, but realised that your report was triggering a slightly different bug than the other. Re-opening yours as a unique issue.

Thanks,

Kirk
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Hi Alyssa,

Thank you for your patience, our product team have remediated this issue. 
Can you please retest it to ensure that the fixes are in place before we close this off as 'Resolved'? 

Once again, thank you for keeping our customers secure.

Kind regards,
Felix

activities.message: The vulnerability  appears to be properly fixed and as of now  I haven't been able to recreate it

Thanks for the prompt re-test. I have marked the issue as resolved. Have a wonderful day!

Kind regards,
Felix

activities.message:
Hi Alyssa,

Ideally, we would not prefer to publicly disclose reports/vulnerabilities so as to clear all low-hanging ones and publish only unusual and unique issues. Therefore I kindly request you to not choose to Publicly disclose this report.

Thank you once again for your report and efforts.

Regards,
Felix
